AG Holder proposes shift in drug policy

In remarks prepared for delivery later today to the American Bar Association, Attorney General Eric Holder said he is mandating a change to Justice Department policy so that low-level, non-violent drug offenders won’t be charged with offenses that impose mandatory minimum sentences.
  • Loading comments... | Add yours Share now:

Abducted R.I. boy safe

A 2-year-old boy kidnapped from a Rhode Island home where police found two bodies was found Sunday night "in good health," police said.
  • Police pursue links in case

Funding, results tied

Portions of each college's budget will be tied to its ability to improve graduation rates, meet workforce needs, and help more minority students thrive.

The cost of weather-related power outages is high and rising as storms grow more severe and the US electric grid gets older.

Sinkhole causes resort villa in Florida to partially collapse
